name: Runway East
description:
Helping startups take off with flexible coworking, private offices and events connecting London’s best community of startups, scale-ups, investors and innovators. Runway East believes startups take off when they work side by side, so each of our buildings, or ‘runways’ contain meticulously crafted environments and services specifically designed to inject energy, ideas and friendship into the work our members do. 

Three locations in Shoreditch & The City host over 1000 members of the London tech community.

team.title: Co-Founder
team.name: Philipp Stoeckl
team.bioHtml: Operations. Investment. Strategy. Digital. Currently: Co-Founder, Runway East + (something new)

team.title: CEO
team.name: Natasha Guerra

team.name: Alex Hoye
team.bioHtml:
CEO & Co-Founder: Faction Skis
Chairman: Runway East
Listed first co-founded startup in 2006
Formation at Disney/Harvard/McKinsey

team.title: Membership Manager (Sales)
team.name: Megan Gubler
team.bioHtml: Worked at Runway East, Boutique Air. Experience with Administrative Assistant, Billing, Customer Relationship Management

jobs.title: Financial Controller
jobs.description:
Runway East helps amazing startups grow, thrive and succeed - We do that by offering exceptional space, opportunities and community to the most innovative businesses in the UK. Currently, we run 4 active locations across London and Bristol and are planning significant growth through 2019/2020.

The Role

As our Finance Manager, you’ll report directly to the CFO and work alongside our Management Accountant. The core responsibilities of the role are -

* Ensuring the accuracy of the P&L and balance sheet reconciliations
* Preparation of management accounts and group consolidations
* Preparation of monthly board reports
* Reporting to internal and external stakeholders
* Quarterly VAT returns
* Oversee AR/AP ledgers
* Cashflow reporting
* Preparation of monthly payroll
* Run the annual audit process, assist with statutory accounts and CT computations and returns

There will also be a wide range of ad hoc project work e.g. FP&A for new locations, assisting with landlord proposals etc.

Requirements

Who You Are

The Non-Negotiables

* Outstanding attention to detail
* Excellent communicator
* Familiar with accounting software like Xero
* Experienced in preparing management accounts

The Negotiables

* Industry and practice experience, ideally previous startup experience
* Experience implementing new systems, processes and controls
* Experience managing a small team / developing junior team members

Benefits

* A competitive salary and discretionary stock options
* 23 days’ holiday (incl. 3 discretionary days between Christmas and New Year) plus all bank holidays
* Your Birthday off
* Mac/PC of your choice
* Pension
* Vitality Health (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vitality.co.uk%2F) insurance
* Office Happy Hour on Fridays
* Regular socials and team retreats (Rhodes, Vilnius and Barcelona so far…)

More About Us

These are our values, if you share them, let’s talk.

Community First. Our job is to get our fantastic startups where they want to be. At the end of the day, their success is our success.

We’re Open. We’re honest, encouraging and hungry to learn. Every mistake we make is a chance to make what we do better.

We Give a Damn. We care fiercely about the projects and people we work with. We thrive on challenges, on excitement and on Getting Shit Done.

We’re Entrepreneurs. To us, entrepreneurial means taking the initiative. We’re a group of people driven by creativity, by the ability to spot opportunities, solutions and new ideas - and by the excitement of trying to get those ideas off the ground.

Closing date: We will be reviewing applications the week commencing the 21st October - and looking to hold final interviews early November.

jobs.title: Office, Events & Reception Hero
jobs.description:
The Job: Elevator Pitch

We help amazing startups grow, thrive and succeed. We do that by offering space, advice, facilities and opportunities to the startups and entrepreneurs who work with us.

Right now our community of 1,500 members work, meet, think (and occasionally) drink from our four thriving locations in London and Bristol.

We’re lucky enough to work with the most innovative, exciting and passionate entrepreneurs in the UK, and we’re on the hunt for an organised, enthusiastic, self-starting Office Assistant and Reception Hero to be the first port of call for our wonderful start-ups.



The Job: The Nitty Gritty

This is a fast-paced and exciting role at the heart of our community always looking to make our members experience even better. You’ll be our eyes and ears on the front desk: making our guests feel welcome and creating a lasting first impression.

As our Office and Reception Hero, you’ll be the first port of call at our London Bridge site. Keeping a keen eye on the practical running of our reception desk - providing a warm, welcoming experience for all of our members and guests. You will be on hand to support the day to day needs of the business.

You’ll learn great office skills, get operations and some event experience, as well as become entrenched in a network of the latest innovators of the UK tech scene.



What You’ll Be Doing

Providing a warm welcome

You’ll be the first interaction our start-ups and entrepreneurs have, so a warm, welcoming demeanour and a love of people is a must. You’ll ensure our front desk is tidy and looking its best, you’ll take pride in our space and help ensure it’s the best it can be at all times.

Handling member and guest enquiries

Answering calls and responding to emails in a timely manner, using sales training where appropriate. Dealing with calls/walk-ins first hand, reporting any messages and feedback to the community, membership and management team etc., where appropriate - ensuring that people are put in touch with who they need to see.

Keeping the office on track

On a day-to-day basis there are core elements which are crucial to your role, these are the fundamentals you need to be nailing every day, week and month to help us deliver a truly exceptional experience to the team and members alike.

Managing the post, answering calls and emails and assisting with building operations work, you’ll make sure that our day-to-day runs smoothly and efficiently everyday. Maintaining the privacy of members and the security in the building. Identifying and signing in visitors and supplying them with visitor badges. Assisting with the onboarding of new members to Runway East.

Joining our adventure

We’re a team of experienced entrepreneurs who want to make the happiest, most productive, most exciting working environment in town, n
